posts.name: Kane Barnes
posts.cooked: Hello, I am currently having trouble with getting a value to update on Shuffleboard, because it is crashing on launch. It is attempting to create an infinite amount of tabs due to the code being in periodic (configure also didn’t work when I tested it). I have looked at other posts about this, however none of the other fixes have worked for me. I am also trying NOT to use SmartDashboard logic since we’re trying to make the GUI all code generated. If anybody could help me out, it would be greatly appreciated! Also, if you have any questions regarding the code, let me know and I’ll do my best to answer.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You need to add the tab in robotInit().  Shuffleboard doesn’t allow the creation of duplicate tabs, and adding the tab is a step you only need (or want) to do once.

posts.name: Kane Barnes
posts.cooked: I have tried this, however it will only update during the initialization. It won’t update something such as a boolean, which is what I need. Is there a way to update the cell from periodic or something like that? Basically, my problem is that Init can create the cell, but it won’t ever update the cell.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You need to save the return value of the add function into a GenericEntry instance variable.  That variable is what you update in periodic, e.g. with setDouble() etc.

posts.name: Kane Barnes
posts.cooked: Thanks, I’ll check it out and let you know how it goes.

posts.name: Kane Barnes
posts.cooked: I attempted to use GenericEntry and use our boolean value in multiple different ways, but none of them have worked. This includes trying to update the variable in periodic, but it doesn’t seem to update properly. It could also be the declaring of the variable since it’s the wrong value on the robot’s initialization (starting as false), but it should be true since that’s the default, and it always shows true on startup via SmartDashboard. It is updating correctly on the SmartDashboard network table, so I’m not sure why Shuffleboard won’t update along with it.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Please share your code.  Something like the following should work:

posts.name: Kane Barnes
posts.cooked: Yeah, I just reread the docs, implemented some logic, used what you said, etc and I finally got it working. Thank you so much for the help! Took 3 days to make a box turn green! lol

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
